body: Facing the same issue here in R. However, completely functional in python.
I can't provide code but I had a very similar problem on my Mac. Then, after restarting RStudio, things worked.Did you try that?

> I can't provide code but I had a very similar problem on my Mac. Then, after restarting RStudio, things worked.Did you try that?

Thank you for your input, however I am running on windows and tried this several times and to run on different machines but the problem persists

To overcome the first error (processx_exec), set this env_var:

`Sys.setenv(MLFLOW_BIN = "C:/Users/[YOURNAME]/Anaconda3/envs/r-mlflow-1.10.0/Scripts/mlflow")`

the default is `C:/Users/[YOURNAME]/Anaconda3/envs/r-mlflow-1.10.0/mlflow`, that is the wrong path.

If that turns out to be true, mlflow should look in this place by default too? This should work out of the box without having to set the env variable. Also, does the problem persist with version 1.11?

Here is a minimal GH actions run for version 1.10 that fails on Windows but not on Linux (macOS fails on a known other problem) for 
```r
library(mlflow) # unecessary but I ran it
mlflow::install_mlflow()
mlflow::mlflow_log_param("param1", 5)
```
CI run: https://github.com/lorenzwalthert/mlflow-test-3206/runs/1254717629?check_suite_focus=true#step:9:354

Indeed, the executable seems [under `Scripts/`](https://github.com/lorenzwalthert/mlflow-test-3206/runs/1254717629?check_suite_focus=true#step:9:317). 

This basically means the latest version of mlflow is not usable out of the box for R windows users. ðŸ˜© 

cc: @yitao-li.

After that, the bug it this, digging into the code and running from CLI:

`Scripts\> mlflow server --port 5542 --backend-store-uri "D:\Workspaces\RStudio\mlflow\R\mlflow\mlruns" --host 127.0.0.1 --port 5542 --workers 4`
` "waitress replaces gunicorn on Windows, "
NotImplementedError: waitress replaces gunicorn on Windows, cannot specify --gunicorn-opts or --workers`

New info:

After trying without the --workers, I see that the --backend-store-uri must start with file:// to be local (and forward slashes):

`mlflow server --port 5542 --backend-store-uri "file://D:/Workspaces/RStudio/mlflow/R/mlflow/mlruns" --host 127.0.0.1 --port 5542`

After starting there is a message:

`c:\users\franz\anacon~1\envs\r-mlfl~1.0\lib\site-packages\waitress\adjustments.py:445: DeprecationWarning: In future versions of Waitress clear_untrusted_proxy_headers will be set to True by default. You may opt-out by setting this value to False, or opt-in explicitly by setting this to True.
  DeprecationWarning,
Serving on http://i.forbesimg.com:5542`

I am not sure this is the problem. I think it's as simple as that the binary is not correctly located. This is my understanding from looking at the error trace posted [above](https://github.com/lorenzwalthert/mlflow-test-3206/runs/1254717629?check_suite_focus=true#step:9:354):

```r
 Command 'C:/Miniconda/envs/r-mlflow-1.10.0/mlflow' not found @win/processx.c:994 (processx_exec)>
 Stack trace:
 1. mlflow::mlflow_log_param("param1", 5)
 2. zeallot:::`%<-%`(c(client, run_id), resolve_client_and_run_id(client,  ...
 3. base:::tryCatch(multi_assign(substitute(x), value, parent.frame()),  ...
 4. base:::tryCatchList(expr, classes, parentenv, handlers)
 5. base:::tryCatchOne(tryCatchList(expr, names[-nh], parentenv,  ...
 6. base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
 7. base:::tryCatchList(expr, names[-nh], parentenv, handlers[-nh])
 8. base:::tryCatchOne(expr, names, parentenv, handlers[[1L]])
 9. base:::doTryCatch(return(expr), name, parentenv, handler)
 10. zeallot:::multi_assign(substitute(x), value, parent.frame())
 11. mlflow:::resolve_client_and_run_id(client, run_id)
 12. mlflow:::mlflow_get_active_run_id_or_start_run()
 13. rlang:::`%||%`(mlflow_get_active_run_id(), mlflow_id(mlflow_start_run()))
 14. mlflow:::mlflow_id(mlflow_start_run())
 15. mlflow:::mlflow_start_run()
 16. mlflow:::mlflow_client()
 17. mlflow:::new_mlflow_client(tracking_uri)
 18. mlflow:::new_mlflow_client.mlflow_file(tracking_uri)
 19. mlflow:::mlflow_server(file_store = path, port = mlflow_connect_port())
 20. base:::do.call("mlflow_cli", c("server", args, list(background = getOption( ...
 21. mlflow:::mlflow_cli("server", "--port", 5919, "--backend-store-uri",  ...
 22. withr:::with_envvar(env, { ...
 23. base:::force(code)
 24. process$new(mlflow_bin, args = unlist(args), echo_cmd = verbose,  ...
 25. .subset2(public_bind_env, "initialize")(...)
 26. processx:::process_initialize(self, private, command, args, stdin,  ...
 27. rethrow_call(c_processx_exec, command, c(command, args), stdin,  ...

 x Command 'C:/Miniconda/envs/r-mlflow-1.10.0/mlflow' not found @win/processx.c:994 (processx_exec) 
```

Depending on what `mlflow:::python_mlflow_bin()` will return, we can verify that. As you pointed out, it should be `C:/Miniconda/envs/r-mlflow-1.10.0/Scripts/mlflow.exe`, but the above shows it gives `C:/Miniconda/envs/r-mlflow-1.10.0/mlflow` (wrong folder and wrong extnsion).

Debugging return values:
```
mlflow:::python_mlflow_bin()
[1] "C:/Miniconda/envs/r-mlflow-1.10.0/mlflow"
mlflow:::python_bin()
[1] "C:\\Miniconda\\envs\\r-mlflow-1.10.0\\python.exe"
dir(dirname(mlflow:::python_bin())) # is mlflow here?
[truncated]
[54] "python3.dll"                                  
[55] "python36.dll"                                 
[56] "python36.pdb"                                 
[57] "pythonw.exe"                                  
[58] "pythonw.pdb"                                  
[59] "Scripts"      
[truncated]
dir(file.path(dirname(mlflow:::python_bin()), "Scripts")) # or here?
[ truncated]
[13] "idle.exe"               "mako-render.exe"        "mlflow.exe"            
[truncated]
```
These values from the [ci/cd run](https://github.com/lorenzwalthert/mlflow-test-3206/runs/1255032143?check_suite_focus=true#step:8:328) confirm for me that the mlflow binary no longer lays in the same folder as the python binary (which is an assumption of `mlflow:::python_mlflow_bin()`. Hence, the binary is not found. Not sure it must have the `.exe` suffix too or not.

How to fix? I think we need a PR to mlflow that includes:

* A test if the binary can be found and run it to test. I hope something like `system2(mlflow:::python_mlflow_bin(), "--version")` would work. This test should fail with the current version of mlflow on Windows. Maybe we need to temporarily unset some env variables set by the parent process like `$MLFLOW_HOME` (e.g. as set in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/dev/install-common-deps.sh#L52).
* Fix `mlflow:::python_mlflow_bin()` to look in `Scripts/` subfolder for the binary and see all tests passing (hopefully).

This is a major bug IMO and makes it unusable for R users on windows, so I think we must look into this asap. @smurching @javierluraschi @harupy @yitao-li @dmatrix . 

Context: The localisation of the executable (the reason this issue was opened) is fundamentally the same as #3319, #1009 and the timeout (described below) the same as #3393 and #3077.

It's apparently more complicated than what I outlined in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/3206#issuecomment-708580435. First, there are no windows tests for R, so we can't show (and later test) the problematic behavior. In addition, setting the executable right does not solve the problem, because `mlflow_client()` will still time out as reported in #3393 and #3077. I have the suspicion that the problem occurs within `mlflow:::mlflow_client()` with the file path that has two `:` on Windows, e.g. `"file://D:/a/mlflow-test-3206/mlflow-test-3206/mlruns"` as shown [here](https://github.com/lorenzwalthert/mlflow-test-3206/runs/1257884865?check_suite_focus=true#step:9:28).  

I think to properly solve this, one needs access to a Windows machine which I currently don't have and I also don't have time to look into this. 

**Edit:** I believe there is a missing `/` in the R output that Python has. According to wikipedia , file:// is never correct: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File_URI_scheme#How_many_slashes?

In my quest to get the current CI workflow of `MLflow R` working on Windows (i.e., https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/3766) I found out XGBoost installation via Conda is only supported on Linux and MacOS. There may be some workaround such this limitation but we'll also need to think about how maintainable such workaround might be.

I think I should skip installing XGBoost and all XGBoost-related tests on Windows for now.

I agree @yitao-li. Let's first focus on getting mlflow running for R, as very basic functionality is not there (reprex here: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/3206#issuecomment-708535937). You can find some more experimentation I did here: https://github.com/lorenzwalthert/mlflow-test-3206/commits/main. In particular, I got 
```
Error in curl::curl_fetch_memory(url, handle = handle) : 
  Failed to connect to 127.0.0.1 port 5816: Connection refused
Calls: <Anonymous> ... request_fetch -> request_fetch.write_memory -> <Anonymous>
Execution halted
```
with `mlflow:::mlflow_validate_server(client)`  with https://github.com/lorenzwalthert/mlflow/pull/5, which should return the correct number of trailing slashes as described in the PR description, but still does not work. But probably it's easier if you start debuging again from scratch ðŸ¤”. I hope you have an interactive windows env available, this is very annoying to debug otherwise -.- Also, I don't know what the latest version of ML flow is that worked on windows for R - if any.
also, once running, we can see how the problem with the missing conda package is sovled in Python xgboost
